values:
... am I wrong to feel hurt and a little bit betrayed that, even considering that tomorrow is my birthday, my own boyfriend actually made plans to stay with other friends tonight, instead of with me?

Am I just being a typical over-emotional female?  Am I wrong to feel so upset?  Or am I even the slightest bit justified?  I know that he's probably not thinking of me; he's probably thinking of having a fun time with friends that he doesn't get to see every day.  But, still, somehow that just doesn't make me feel any better at all ... as a matter of fact, it kind'a makes me feel rather inferior and worthless right now.

... I mean ... it's my birthday.  It only comes once a year ... I was with him on his birthday ... why don't I rank high enough for him to be with me for mine?

Oh well.  I can't think about this now.  I said no drama, and I intend to stick by that rule ... I can't hold other people to a standard that I don't hold myself to in the first place.  So now, I have to put this out of my mind, and just smile, and not think about it again until Monday.

Good morning, Dracula~!

Heya, prior neighbors!  Guess who's back in your 'hood again?  =D  I realize it's a little bit late, but here are the tentative plans for the weekend:

Today - Snowboarding at Big Bear with Radiant!  I haven't been snowboarding in two or three years; I really hope I don't break anything while trying to get back into the proverbial saddle!  XP  Since it's so last-minute I don't expect anyone to join us in the snow, but if you have a board or are jonesin' for a little wintertime cold-weather action, and happen to have the day off and feel like a drive, we'll be at Snow Summit or Bear Mountain. 

Tomorrow - Disneyland!  With everyone who wants to or can come!  I realize that some people don't have passes and Disney is pretty a'pensive, so probably either lunch or dinner or possibly even both will be outside of the park somewhere.  Typically we eat somewhere in Downtown, but anywhere local is up for suggestion.  I pretty much assume that eats will be dictated by popular vote, unless I *really* get a hankering for somewhere in specific, in which case I reserve the Birthday right of picking the place.  ^ ^;

Sunday - Busy, busy, busy!  I'm going to be trying to cram a whole mess of stuff into just half of a day.  > <;  Early in the morning I'll be hopefully joining the faithful at the Church of 'Scoes, then after that I'm going to try to hit Kinokuniya, Marukai, Mitsuwa, Kitty House, DVD Planet and Sugoi.  I don't know what order they're going to be in because I don't yet know where I'll be waking up Sunday morning (sounds sort'a bad, doesn't it?), and I don't even really know if it's possible to make it to all of those places in less than twelve hours, and then still make the long drive back to the Bay Area, but I'm gonna give it a whirl.  Most of them are just optional would-really-like-to-go places, but if nothing else, I have to make it to Marukai and Kinokuniya, because I have to buy stuff for class there.  Hee hee ... I'm so backwards.  I'm going to school in NorCal but I buy all my school supplies from SoCal.  Whut.  XD

Annnd that's the scoop!  I'm really excited and looking forward to a fun weekend, so I'll see you all when I see you!

<3

The Fine Print - ... this is kind'a hard to say without sounding fatalistic, but ... in the hopes of preserving peace and sanity for this weekend, I'm going to say this now and get it off my chest: Whenever a large group of my friends have gotten together recently, it seems that there has been a tendency for drama to percolate.  There's gonna be a bunch of us all together in one place for a good while this weekend, and I really don't want a happy occasion to turn into an unhappy one.  I'm not accusing anyone directly, I'm just pointing out that some people's personalities just naturally don't click that well with some others.  I mean, hell, there's even some personality traits in my own friends that irk me sometimes, and I know I've got some personality traits that irk some of you sometimes.  But I'm asking you all, pretty-please, with a cherry on top, for my sake, as a birthday present, PLEASE refrain from drama-mongering this weekend, and in return, I solemnly promise to do the same.

Much Love,

- Me -

... what the f*ck?!  Stir the chicken already!!

</AX quoteables>

XD

P.S. - Happy 4th of July everyone!

P.P.S. - This new laptop is totally a Decepticon.  This morning he's managed to screw up every log-in anyone in the room has tried to use on him.  > >;

<lj-cut text="... have you missed me?">

So.  This will be about my first LJ post since I lost my job, I think ... been a while.  And considering that it's me, even though it's been months and months since I've been on here, what's the one thing I'd wanna blog about?  Life?  Meh.  All that's happened since I've been gone?  Meh.  Transformers?  WINNER.

What, who, me?  Predictable?  Like only Starscream himself could be, my dears.

So, yeah, I make little to no sense.  I don't care.  Maybe I'll get to the normal stuff later.  In the meantime, I'm gonna enjoy ranting at my 'Journal about my newest form of delicious kryptonite.  If you don't care much for Transformers, I'd suggest sitting this one out.  If you don't care much for Transformers: Animated ... RUN.

So.

How long has it been since TF:A came out?  How long has it been since I snapped up my V-class Harrier jet and the big ol' L-class Osprey-lookin' talking helicopter to match?  I started collecting the Animated line before I lost my job.  I had the pilot in hand shortly after the Prime/Megs D-class set hit store shelves.  I bought Season One shortly after my forced move to the Bay Area.

But (excepting the pilot, of course) did I ever WATCH the stuff ... ?  No.  Bad me!  Always had some reason to put it off ...

... until now.

I was out with a violent stomach flu this last week and a half, complicated by an emergency double root canal smack in the middle of it, and with the lack of mobility beyond my bed came a sudden re-inspection of my DVD collection, or at least what's out of packing boxes at this point in time.  Lo and behold, what should meet my eyes but the cover of Season One?  Having nothing better to do, and mindful of an outstanding promise to actually watch the series, I popped in the Animated ... and was summarily blown away.

Thusly - welcome to the wide world of TF:A fangirling ... Population: me. 

I am so in love.  Animated Starscream is just perfect; I could watch him mock Megs for hours on end.  And he sounds so much like himself ... I mean, he'll never be Chris Latta but Primus almighty he's DAMN close.  So too with Ultra Magnus; he sounds so much like Robert Stack sometimes that it's scary!  I could just hear him introducing Unsolved Mysteries ... and Megs.  Oh, Megs.  That big old beast is sexy, sexy Transformers candy.  Strange, still, in a sense that his voice could deviate so much from Welker's signature rasp and yet work SO WELL ... I have decided that he is essentially the Hannibal Lecter of Megatrons, notwithstanding the fact that he hasn't actually nommed any chassis.  That I've seen.  Anyways ... Beast Megs voicing Prime, Shockwave voicing Megs, SpongeBob Squarepants voicing Starscream, the original voices of Arcee, Blur (haven't got to him talking yet, tho) and top it all off with Weird Al voicing Wreck-Gar - AND actually getting the song title in as a line! - it's not how I would have expected the rebirth of Transformers, but OH MY PRIMUS it works.

So well.

Granted, it's not G1.  Nothing will ever be G1.  But for as silly, cheesy, and juvenile as TF:A can be at times, it is unfailingly endearing at a basic level that leaves me squealing for more.  In less than a week I've blown through Season One and half of Season Two, but I refuse to put in the second disc just yet for fear that it will go too quickly.  I'm loving this stuff, and I wanna drag it out for as long as I can!  <3

Thoughts Thus Far - 

- PRIME - I know that's Beast Megs voicing him.  I can't take him all that seriously, but I've decided to consider him as being some strange amalgamation of Optimus and Orion Pax, and it works.
- RATCHET - sounds like an ancient Ironhide.  Took me a long time to get used to him, but now his crotchety-ness is straight-up loveable.
- PROWL - is so totally a strange ninja cross between Abe Sapien and Niles Crane.  Tell me he's not!
- BUMBLEBEE - is just cute.  And irritating.  And cutely irritating.  I can't decide whether I want to snuggle him or slap him around a bit with a large trout.  O o;
- BULKHEAD - ... is still a bit too much for me, even for comic relief.  But he has his moments.
- ULTRA MAGNUS - has a camshaft up his butt half the time, but he sounds just like Robert Stack, so I guess I forgive him.  I mean, I guess it's what your Elite Guard Commanders do, goin' around bein' all serious and stuff all the time.
- JAZZ - NEEDS MORE SCREEN TIME!!  And needs to team up with Prowl more, cyber-ninjas represent!
- BLURR - Still waiting for him to talk.  And transform.  Though I might wanna be careful what I wish for.  XD
- SENTINEL AKA "TICK PRIME" - is the biggest butt-munch I think I've ever seen represented in animation short of Cobra Commander.  XP  I want to drop-kick him out an air lock.  Currently his action figure is sitting on top of the piano wearing Bulkhead's Headmaster accessory 'cause I despise him so much.

- MEGATRON - IS LOVE!!  I can't say enough about him.  I wish he got more air time, but then the whole series would practically be about him.  Not that *I'D* be complaining any.  <3
- STARSCREAM - IS ALSO LOVE!!  Even when he's getting his butt handed to him.  But let's face it - when Screamer's getting his skidplate thrashed it's usually quite deserved. ... okay, it's always quite deserved.  I love him anyways.  He's so cute in his warped way.  I could'a just cried when he made his sad little face after discovering his spark chamber was empty.  Still my favorite Transformer ... but Meggers gives him a good run for his money.  Screamer DEFINITELY needs more screen time, though; I waited practically all of Season One to see him again after the pilot, and Megs made short work of him after that.  =/
- BLACKARACHNIA - has her moments.  Jury's still out on the Pred.  (Yes, I said PRED.)
- BLITZWING - Crazy boy is crazy.  > >;  But he's mostly amusing.  I still prefer his sane mode best.  Oh, and his toy is SWEEEEET.
- LUGNUT - IS TOTALLY GAY FOR MEGATRON.  But that particular position's already been filled by Starscream, sorry Lugbutt.  >]  I just gotta mock him every time he's on screen.  XD   
  
- I have GOT to get a hold of a screen cap of Megatron holding his oil-barrel-twisted-into-a-wine-goblet from the Constructicon episode.  OMP.  That shot made me lawl so hard.  "It's my own personal blend ..."  YEAH I'LL BET!!  Just goes to show you that us 'Cons are more cultured than you loser 'Bots.  XD
- Similarly, I've got to find a way to make an icon of Starscream mocking Megs.  Or getting flung repeatedly into the river.  Either will suffice.  Oy.
- And I must rip audio of Megatron chasing down Starscream, who bails with the line of, "I'm sorry, you must have me confused with some other Harrier jet!"   

Ahhhhh ....

... moar Animated, please.
</lj-cut>

I'm just the most recent in a series of many, I feel ... 

... but I just lost my job.

They call it "rebalancing" here, but essentially ... laid off.  Like so many others.

I've never been laid off before.

"Times are tough," my boss says.  Yeah.  Tough.

So, I join the ranks of the unemployed ... right after I clean out my desk, clean out my computer, turn over my equipment and say my probably very tearful good-byes.

And this will be my last post from Mentor.

So I got on the plane in San Jose this morning and flew back in to Orange County ... ... wearing my Megatron jacket. This might not be a big thing to some, but I was on my guard the whole way, 'cause I could have easily wound up like this poor guy here. He got booted from his flight 'cause he was wearing a shirt featuring ['08 movie version] Optimus Prime "brandishing" a gun. Megatron, uhm, well ... IS A GUN. Plus I was on a Southwest Airlines flight, who has a recent history of hassling females in my age group over "unsavory" attire. Granted, I wasn't flashing a whole lot of flesh, just a big silvery screen-printed Decepticon leader. But in my case, luckily, not a word was spoken, so ... it makes one wonder why. Our [lighthearted] theory? The asshat security guard and supervisor who picked on that poor guy over at Heathrow airport must be Decepticon pretenders. Anyways! Time to go home and pass out and catch up on all the sleep I missed all last week. XP P.S. - So, it looks like Transformers II has been given a name. What was wrong with calling it "Transformers II," I wonder? Ah, well; the article made me giggle. You better bet I'm gonna be watching for a big huge hell-fiery Cybertronian tank-demon in the next movie, now.

<lj-cut text="i r lemming.">
Comment and I will ...

1. Tell you why I friended you.
2. Associate you with something - a fandom, a song, a colour, a photo, etc.
3. Tell you something I (dis)like about you.
4. Tell you a memory I have of you.
5. Ask something I've always wanted to know about you.
6. Tell you my favorite user pic of yours.

In return, you must post this in your LJ. (if you <strike>want</strike> haven't done so already!)

Stolen from FireShark, who stole it from somewhere else, I think ... </lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="SKITCRACK.">
Yes!  So!  This post is about a week late.  Unf.  I had to work at the San Jose campus Tuesday and Wednesday after the con, and then I didn't get back until right before I had to go to (normal, regular, here) work on Thursday, so I've kind'a been dead and catching up since.

But!

Here's the YouTube goodness that was our Fanime 2008 Masquerade Skit (y'know, to prove I was there and all > >;) aptly (or perhaps more rediculously) entitled, "Maximum Pwnage."

If you talked to any of us in the cast, tho, we commonly referred to it as skitcrack.

Yes, skitcrack.  That which keeps you up until three in the morning LOLing over proto-audio, burns out your muscles after MONTHS of practicing Para Para (only to have your three-minute routine pared down to twenty-five seconds, oy), steals all your hours of sleep assembling "life-sized" props and poseable bits and all sorts of nonsense ... That which leads you into a pr0n shoppe in the middle of the night in search of a blow-up doll with no orifices.  (Don't look at me; it was Venom's idea!)

Yah.  Skitcrack.

<lj-embed id="2"/>

I was teh Morrigan (that's the green-haired, bat-winged chick for those of you who don't know yer videogames) in the group, and boy, let me tell you, it was really an honor to get to work with a group like this.  ^_^  Every single person brought something to the performance, and brought out the best in one another.  Except Judy.  She's just an airhead.  XD  (Judy is the blow-up doll, btw.  ^_~)  I wish that all Masquerades could be as much fun as this one was!

... well, minus Juggernaut going missing backstage and sending us all into a panic.

... and minus harness/prop/lighting/progress book malfunctions of every kind in the final twenty-four hour stretch.

... and minus not finishing my costume until (I shit you not) twenty minutes before judging.

... and minus breaking a wing on stage.

XD

P.S. - Because it's too funny to pass up: guess who was at Fanime this year?

<lj-embed id="3"/>

He was a con-goer, too, mind you - he was NOT with the protestors; note the Fanime badge around his neck.  =3  We had our own experience with a "miracle" ourselves, but I'll save that for the con report (and if you were at Fanime, odds are you've already heard it anyways!).

P.P.S. - If you don't get the phrase "I'm the Juggernaut, Bitch!" then you'll have to watch this one, too:

<lj-embed id="4"/>

And now, back to catching up on a week's worth of work ... </lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="I'll leave you with an amusing interlude.">

Fans of the YouTube vids "Shockwave's Burden," "The Rude Awakening of Optimus Prime," and "Soundwave: the Touch" might get a kick out of the below ...

http://www.collegehumor.com/video:1808795

XD

"JUST A TWIST!!"

Okay, done being an 80's nerd now; gotta go catch my flight.  'Cause you know, if I'm late, Octane will leave without me.  AGAIN.

See you all on Monday!  Have a great weekend everyone!

<3

</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="One more!">
Yay, my contacts came in today!!  ^_^  So, now, not only can I SEE again, but that's one more step toward a completed costume.

'Cause yes, one or more of said contacts were of the colorful variety.

=P

Still no wig package, though.  Sad, but oh well; mail moves on Saturday, too, so maybe it will come tomorrow.  *nod*nod*  Well, it's high time for this little girl to shut down and head for home, so ...

Have a good weekend everyone!!</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Not the kind of prophetic dreams I would've wanted!">
So last night I had some sort of weird mini-nightmare in which one of my contacts tore in half, and it was the only pair I had left.  In the dream I remember admonishing myself because I knew I was on my last pair, but I still hadn't gone to get new contacts, which is shamefully true to real life, actually. I guess it's kind'a silly to have a mini-nightmare over contacts, but my eyes are so maladjusted to my glasses that it makes focusing in them practically impossible, unless I've been wearing them for about a week straight.  Which never happens, because I don't have that sort of patience and I like being able to see.  I'm not blind in them, but my vision is definitely wonky, and so I really really don't like driving in glasses unless it's an emergency, and even so just for a trip to work, or the store, or someplace nearby.

I also had a bizarre Torchwood-ish dream about some Pulse-like orb that was giving me cool telepathic and telekinetic powers, but was making me increasingly dependent on the energy gain.  And a bit paranoid, too.  But that's really beside the point.

Anyways ...

... I woke up this morning and went to put my contacts in, and the right lens was missing about a 5 mm sliver off the edge, and there was a tear through about the outer third of the contact.

D'oh.

Not the kind of prophetic dreams I would have wanted, yo!  And by the way, I'm supposed to drive home this weekend for Easter, and oh guess what, my optometrist doesn't stock my brand of contacts in my powers, so wouldn't you know it, they have to be ordered, which will take about three to five days.

Which means a drive home in glasses.  At night.  And then the whole weekend in them, too.

DO NOT WANT.

>_<
</lj-cut>

So I'm getting out of the shower this weekend, and I look up to behold that the ceiling in my bathroom has taken on the wrinkledness of a prune. "That can't be good," I think to myself, so of course I call in the roomie and the house-guests, you know, just to make certain that I haven't got my contacts in the wrong eyes and/or have started seeing things again. What does Iri do? Reaches up and pokes the ceiling with a finger. Two things happen at this point; first, the drywall of the ceiling gives like so much sponge cake, and second, his fingernail flakes out a bit of the paint (which had apparently been bubbling, I'm just too short to see), revealing disconcerting amounts of BLACK MOLD above. EEEEEWWW. We got on the phone with maintenance that instant, despite the fact that it was a Saturday, and wonder of wonders! they actually came out to check on it within the hour. They cut a 3' x 3' square out of my ceiling, removing the soggy portion and all its nasty mold spores with it, and peered up into the gaping hole to discover the reason for all the wet: The pipes that run the hot water from the water heater into the air conditioning unit, which is housed above a metal panel in the ceiling of my bathroom, had corroded something awful, and the corrosion had done its worst on the control valve. It had begun leaking, and no one knows how long it's been leaking for, but considering the water content in the ceiling, I'm willing to bet that it's been a while. The maintenance guy said that he'd never seen it happen before in any of the other apartments in the complex. Lucky me. XP So, Saturday night they cut a hole into my ceiling, and then told us that they wouldn't be able to get the plumbers out to work on it until Monday or Tuesday. It turned out to be Tuesday, so yesterday I come home at work to find shiny silvery speckles all over my bathroom. Turned out that in the process of removing and replacing the control valve, they'd dripped silver sautering residue all over my floor. And all over the wall. And the bathroom door, and the closet door, and the counter. And the mirror. I even found splashes of silver on the shower curtain, and on the toilet paper!! It was everywhere; I couldn't believe it! So maintenance told me that they'd come back to replace the linolium and repaint the walls that got damaged. And there's still a yawning hole in my ceiling, because they haven't replaced the drywall up there yet. Grand. I'm not gonna have a bathroom for a month. > <;

Number One on reddit.com right this moment: "ANON hacks Scientology website." http://www.anonymousexposed.org/ ... and yeah, I gotta admit, I totally fell for it, too. Amazing, the difference that just one tiny character can make ... XD P.S. One of the Comments really made me lul, too: "If anonymousexposed.org really is a Scientology site, then this is one of the greatest hacks of all time. * Scientology: 0 * Anonymous: Over NINE THOUSAAAAND!!!!!!!"

<lj-cut text="I has a birfday.

A birfday.

I has it!">

Or, will be having it quite soon.  And because I am rather disillusioned with almost never, ever doing anything but work on my birthday, I have decided that there shall be an attempt to pursue some fun times this year.

Unfortunately, my birthday falls on what will be the second-to-the-last day of my company's fiscal year ... which pretty much means that I'll most likely be working insanely long hours late into the night on my actual birthday.  This happened to me on Halloween, and I wound up stuck here until about nine, which meant that I got next to no time at Disneyland, after the driving and the parking and the shaking and the moving.

Sorry, had to get that Katamari Damacy quote in there.  XD

So, with the above in mind, the plans have been tentatively set as thus:

[ACTUAL BIRFDAY] - Wednesday night will be a dinner-only type thing.  I'd really, really like to just get together with all of my friends, 'cause honestly, there's a bunch of y'all that I only get to see once a month or at conventions, despite the fact that I actually live an hour or so away from some of y'all, and so ... I'd like to get to just hang out with you on my birthday.  I'd like to do dinner: no frills, nothing fancy ... just a nice, casual dinner.

-- PROBLEM IS:  It's a Wednesday.  XP  Which makes any sort of a drive more difficult, and taxing on the system when one considers that they must wake up for work tomorrow.  Plus, I don't know how late I'm gonna get stuck at work, so that makes concrete plans rather difficult to lay, if you'll pardon the pun.  So I don't expect to see a whole lot of people there Wednesday night, and I'm only really counting on about two or three, but it would sure be nice, even if it's only wishful thinking.

-- Ideas for dinner locations include, in order of closing times:  Old Spaghetti Factory, Curry House [with chances of DDR at Boomers], Dave and Buster's at Spectrum [with chances of DDR-alternative i.e. whatever-that-is in the game room], or Denny's, if all else fails.  XP

[BIRFDAY WEEKEND] - Since my actual birthday is gonna be pretty much bunk, I plan to use the weekend as a substitute.  =)  So I'm planning to cram a bit of fun and stuff into Saturday and Sunday, despite the fact that January 30th will have been a few days prior.  XD

-- PROBLEM IS:  ... I don't know exactly what I want to do yet.  XP  I wanna get to see people, so I want to do something that includes everyone, or can include everyone, so I'm just gonna throw out some ideas to see who's interested in what.  If more people can/would do one thing over another, then I'd like to go that route.

Possibilities include:

- [DISNEYLAND!]  - This is a thought because I know that a bunch of my friends have annual passes, making it free for them to go.  I don't actually have a pass, but I plan on purchasing the first stage of one on my next visit.  And since I haven't been to the park proper in ... well, a real long time, and I've only ever been to California Adventures once (and that was rushed and complicated), I'd like to go back, a'specially for my birthday!  It also makes it much easier to gather for dinner at Downtown Disney, 'cause we'd already be on site.
-- COMPLICATION(S):  It's pricey for people who DON'T have passes (don't I know!) and considering the weather lately, it's liable to rain.  So that makes it a little less alluring as a prospect.  But Downtown Disney doesn't require admission, so it's still a possibility for dinner.

- [MEDIEVAL TIMES!]  -  Simply because I've ALWAYS wanted to go, and despite the fact that I live less than an hour away from the 39, I've NEVER BEEN.  And it seems the sort of fun, once-in-a-lifetime type of experience that one might indulge in for one's birthday.  And it's indoors, so even if it does rain on Saturday, we won't get wet!
-- COMPLICATION(S):  Once again, it's pricey, and I'm not sure how many people would wanna go.  Plus it's just a dinner event, and it's getting to be last-minute and I'm not sure if we could still get in.

- [SNOW!]  - Because I bought a brand-new snowboard last year and I only got to use it once before the season was over, and because I haven't been yet this year, and because at least three of my friends have said that they would be willing to try snowboarding with me, and because I'm an addict, and because snow is beautiful to play about in even if you aren't barreling down a slope, and, and, and.  If we went, it would prolly be to Big Bear, 'cause um Squaw and Heavenly and Mammoth are all a little far away, nevermind how much better the Sierra resorts are than what we've got local.
-- COMPLICATIONS(S):  It's a bit of a drive, it could storm and thus require chains, it could be COLD, not everyone might want to play in the snow, not everyone might want to try snowboarding, snowboard rentals can be pricey too, learning to snowboard can HURT (this I know), and I kind'a really don't want everyone to go home from my birthday in pain.  =/

- Then there's all sorts of other, less spectacular options, like going to a movie, or going to a roller rink, or going to the coast, or whatnot.  I'm open to suggestions if it pleases the majority!  =)

[SUNDAY]  - Will prolly be spent in the pursuit of DDR!  There is a 4th (that's right, an archaic 4th!!) Mix at the local Boomers with which I am madly in love, and there's at least three other Boomers that I know have cabinets, and the arcade at the Town Centre, and failing all else there's still Super Arcade!  XD  And since we'll be at Boomers at least once anyways, there will probably be miniature golf in addition to the DDR-ness, with chances of lazer tag/go-karts/ferris wheels/what-have-you, too.  Weather permitting, of course.

So if you don't want to/can't make whatever happens on Saturday, you can come and geek on Sunday instead.

Let me know!</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="... con report to follow, like at such time as I am no longer DED.  XP">

That is to say, once I have actually gotten some of the sleep and the nutriments that I've been deliberately depriving myself of in favor of cosplay.

XD

I'm finally home from the Holidays/NorCal/ALA.  Technically I've been back since Wednesday but I haven't even unpacked yet, save for to re-pack for Burbank.  The combined efforts of the last two or three weeks have taken a heck of a lot out of me but wow ... was it ever worth it!</lj-cut>

Thanks to everyone who made it all a blast!

<3

Nicked the meme-y thingy from 'cause I thought it was funny. Added my thoughts in italics. Mmmyeah.
In 2007, aesthier resolves to...
Buy new cars.
Heck no! My Autobot would kick my butt if I replaced him!
Keep my music clean.
... it was dirty? Okay, maybe that one song by the Bad Touch ...
Give some aerobics to charity.
... uhhh ...
Find a better paintball.
Yes, yes! And people with which to play with said ammunition!
Go to cosplay every Sunday.
HALLELUJAH.
Cut down on my reading.
Nevaaar!!
Get your own New Year's Resolutions:
Well ... I just felt like I needed to have a new post up, since I've been away for a while. No, I haven't been avoiding/hating on anyone and no, Vincent is still ailing; I haven't got him fixed yet. I've either been busy or I've been financially squeamish since Masi blew his water pump and had to go to the autodoctor for some very pricey repairs. Ah, well; all things considered, I was actually quite lucky - he could have exploded on the 5 halfway between here and home, and I would have been in quite a predicament for Thanksgiving. It would have been quite the suck to have been stuck on Pacheco or the Grapevine in the cold, the fog, and/or the rain! And here's hoping that you all had a happy holiday, yourselves. 'Tis the season-time again already ... can you believe it? Solstice in nineteen days (or eighteen if you're a traditionalist like some peeps I know), Christmas in twenty-two, Hanukkah begins tomorrow night and Kwanzaa is ... uh ... 26th? I don't actually know anyone that celebrates Kwanzaa, I don't think, but I have to list it anyways 'cause I've been watching too much Boondocks, and it was, at the time, somewhat funny. I couldn't actually tell you precisely why, though. At any rate, this 'Journal post has been brought to you by the number 0 and the letter Random. And now ... back to deliberating over contact colors, wig shades, box dimensions and other regularly-scheduled mayhem.

XD

*waves sleepily at you all from Wilsonville*

Yeah, so, I'm in Oregon, taking blatant advantage of the free high-speed wireless internets that come complimentary with this executive suite.  I've never had an executive suite all to myself before!  I've got more room than I know what to do with.  It would be the most awesomest place to host a room party ever ... if only it wasn't in Oregon, and thusly miles away from all my friends.

XP

Pictures, details, and further hysterics to follow at such time that I've actually had some sleep.  It's been one heck of a day, tomorrow promises to be better/worse (depending on how one looks at it), and I gots to be on campus to start training at eight o'clock sharp.

So.

I'ma go sprawl on the ridiculously huge king-size bed, now.

<3

<lj-cut text="A case of nerves.">  So.

For those of you who don't know, last week was my company's Northwest/Southwest Regional Mid-Year Meeting, a series of conferences, seminars, and the obvious meetings that bring together all of the non-strategic account managers and applications engineers on the west coast.  Due to a <strike>lack of planning</strike> valiant attempt to save on costs for our region on the part of the powers that be, it was decided that Mid-Year would be held in my office, here in Irvine.

Thus, for the last month or so, I've been going insane trying to plan for this monster.  Bear in mind, I've only been with the company for a handful of months, and I've never had to try to coordinate something this large before ... so I've been suitably distressed, going into it.  I even gave up going anywhere or doing anything worthwhile for my three-day weekend so that I could dutifully be on-site should anyone decide to stage a last-minute emergency.  Which almost did happen, actually, when one of the managers tried to change the venue at 5:00 PM on Friday the last work-day before.

It was an awful lot of hard work and effort ... but I thought that it would be worth it all, in the end.  The company was treating the region employees to a very extravagant dinner on Tuesday, and there was to be a fun-filled team-building event at the local indoor kart track on Wednesday, and I was looking forward to meeting everyone from corporate and the two regions.  I was exhausted but excited ...</lj-cut>

... and of course, Murphy struck.

<lj-cut text="A case of something else.">The weekend before Mid-Year I managed to pull my back severely, resulting in a constant searing pain in my right shoulder that limited my ability to move and heft anything with a decent amount of weight to it.  Guess who was supposed to help arrange the tables in the conference rooms?  And if that wasn't good enough for Murphy, I ended up getting ridiculously sick on Tuesday night at the lovely four-thousand dollar dinner that corporate sponsored for us ... beautiful Italian restaurant, delicious gourmet menu, and all I could do was sit in my seat and squirm with increasing pain.  I tried to tough it out, but my tormented insides got the better of me and my bosses had no choice but to send me home sick Wednesday morning.  One of them wound up with the same violent stomach flu I was suffering from, too, and I would come to find out that a number of others at Mid-Year came down with varying stages of illness, which of course led everyone to point fingers at everything from the food to the air conditioning.  So I missed over half of the Mid-Year, including the excursion to K1 Speed ... all the planning and coordinating and stressing over details, and I got to reap none of the benefits of my labour.

And then Friday morning, as I'm trying to drag my feverish, aching self out of bed to attend the last day, the texts start coming in from friends at Mikomicon.</lj-cut>

> <;

Here's where I think it can't possibly get any worse.

Here's where I'm wrong.

<lj-cut text="And off to Oregon.">After changing their minds about five times, and leaving it quite literally to the last minute, the powers that be have decided that I'm going to be going to corporate (in Portland, Oregon) for training and conferences this week.  And they're gonna fly me in one day and out the next.  Seriously.  I'm going to be on-site for less than a day, and in the state for just a little over twenty-four hours, and I'm just now recovering from a vicious stomach bug that my boss can attest to himself, but OMG NO I just HAVE to go.

Here's the best part ... I'm going to be in an airplane on SEPTEMBER ELEVENTH.

That, ladies and gentlemen, is something I never, ever thought I'd do.

So, at this point, I'm just beginning to recover from a week's worth of illness, I have little more in my body than juices and Saltine crackers, I'm exhausted and disappointed and stressed to the snapping point ...

... and I have to be on an airplane at noon tomorrow.</lj-cut>

And I thought that commuting back and forth from El Segundo was bad.  > <;

The point of this entry (other than to obviously blow off pent steam, now that I'm well enough to sit up and reach the keys) is to let y'all know why I'm so silent and/or difficult to get a hold of, these past few weeks; I'm not ignoring anyone, and I'm not hermit-ing again, I've just been sick and very, very work-busy.

So ... uhm, see y'all later, hey?

- Me -

Who felt it? USGS site says that it was a 2.5 magnitude about 8 miles north of Lake Elsinore, 9 miles east of me. Not strong enough to do any damage (least, none yet that I've heard of), but strong enough to shake stuff up a bit. Everyone okay? - Edit: Huh. Same site, conflicting reports ... now they're saying that it was a 4.7 magnitude quake! =O - Second Edit : Whoops. Sorry 'bout that; I'm an idiot. It really was a 4.7 quake, but there were a few smaller microquakes associated with the bigger one, and I initially clicked on (and posted the link for) the wrong one. D'uh. Can you tell it woke me up? XP ... and now, for the obvious comment that you all knew was coming: sez the Roomie, "We better check outside for blown Transformers!" XD

I was intending to spend today's post gushing about the wonderful time and the delicious dinner I had with my friend last night ('cept for the lousy sneak-jalapeno-attack in my empanada), and the spectacularly beautiful lunar eclipse (which I struggled to get to see but really wasn't very awake for), and the latest random additions to my Transformers idiocy (the OCD of which I am still shamelessly entertaining) ...

... but I'm still a bit shaken up 'cause I came within about three inches of being involved in an accident on the freeway this morning, and I'm still trying to burn the adrenaline out of my system so that I can function like a normal person.

I'm okay, the car's okay, the (brand-new) phone (that I'd be pissed about breaking two days after purchasing) got thrown, but is okay too.

No love for this ridiculous commute.

OH MY PRIMUS I AM IN THE SAME BUILDING AS SQUARE ENIX. 

*dies* 

One of their offices, anyways. *laughs* I didn't even realize, and wouldn't have either, if the car hadn't stopped at their floor on the way up this morning. You should'a seen me gape. I was like, "Hey, that's a cool Final Fantasy poster ... and stand-up ... and, wow, look at that display ... " and then right about that time was when my eyes caught the mammoth "SQUARE ENIX" plastered across the wall and the elevator doors rolled closed. 

XD 

... so, yeah, for those of you who <strike>haven't already been subjected to my bitching about it</strike> don't already know, I have to work here at the El Segundo office for the whole week. I'm literally across the street (okay, so it's a freeway) from LAX. Seriously; I can see the runway from the office windows. =O Moreover, the building's on PCH which is less-than-three to me ... I'd be in seventh heaven if the commute to and fro wasn't bloody MURDER. 

Thusly, I am actively seeking every opportunity to shirk rush-hour as best I can. So ... anyone in south LA county wanna do lunch/dinner/hang out whilst I'm up here in your neighborhood? 

^ ^

Happy Friday the 13th!  Hope everybody's day was great!

^ ^

<lj-cut text="Teh TransFandom ... I has it.  XD  ... and I has it BAD.">  Ravage get!!  (Here, kitty, kitty ... XD  Tho, really, I wanna know what they were thinking when they double-packed Ravage with Prime, instead of, say, Megatron or Unicron or someone who actually makes SENSE.  O o;)

More importantly, MOVIE GET!! ZOMGFTWYESSS!!  ('scuse me while I go spend the next three hours in front of the DVD player with my face glued to the television like a rabid fangirl.  XD  Seriously, though!  This lousy DVD has given me the runaround for a week now; everywhere I looked, everyone was out of stock, and backordered.  Mmmyay for cheesy 80s movie which makes me happy like a three-year-old.  *^ ^;*  Now, then ... anyone wanna have a Transformers geekfest - I mean party at my place and watch it? =D)

Starscream movie figure finally found, but no get!  DO NOT WANT!!  XP  (Honestly.  Does it seem backward to anyone else that they take Starscream, who was all badass with his massive shoulder intakes and backwards wings and vented helmet, and turn him into some weird-looking whacked-out walking TRIANGLE ... and yet somehow manage to make Bumblebee, who was and has always been straight up laughable at best, into the smexiest lil' yellow and black 'bot around?  I mean, I'm all for equal aesthetic opportunity for all Transformers but did they HAVE to sacrifice my favorite to the Gods of Awkward? ... couldn't they have sacrificed ... I dunno, Frenzy, or something?  Oh, wait; THEY DID.  XD  Sorry, Starscream; I'm still a loyal fangirl, but your new form gets no love from me.)

Oh, yeah, four DVDs of :Armada get, too.  (Tho, I'm thinking of returning them and mustering up some patience until I can actually lay my hands on the box set ... I really dun care for collecting series disc by disc.  > <;  And I'm a far sight more sated now that I've actually been able to locate and obtain the movie.  ^ ^  Decisions, decisions ...)

P.S. - I know I've been spamming everyone with my Transformers OCD kick lately, so this will be the last Unlocked TF post.  Going forward, I'll keep them invisible to everyone save those who have demonstrated an interest in this robotic ridiculousness.  XD  If it doesn't bother you and/or you prefer to be in the Locked-to list, lemme know, 'cause otherwise I'll be making sure that my silly little rants aren't cluttering up your Friends Pages.

Now ... back to geeking out.

P.P.S. - Don't watch the below if you can't take a bit of a joke at Megs and 'Screamer's expense.  But after all the jibes last weekend I just couldn't stand it anymore.  XD  Tee-hee, indeed!  

<lj-embed id="1" /> 

P.P.P.S. - Good GRIEF Megatron is freakishly wide when viewed from the side!  O O; </lj-cut>

Yes; that is who you think it is. Sometimes I can't express myself with words. Usually, I don't have the ability to express myself with images, either ... but today, my expression turned out as perfect as I could possibly make it, considering. Unfortunately self-expression came at the cost of my drawing; what I intended to be a silly little chibi depiction of something that would never, ever happen became an unintentional trip into the depths of my mind. I hadn't thought to lace my imagery with such a woeful tone, and I wonder, now, if I was painting my blank canvas, as it were, with emotions I hadn't even seen rising. By all rights, I ought to be happy and hyper as all heck right now, just as I've been all week ... I really don't know what happened, but I feel as if I just crashed into an invisible wall today. All that blissful giddiness just ... drained away. There's been a couple of suggestions placed to me by others as to what might have brought about such a sudden and drastic shift of dynamic, but how is one to tell, really? It could be one thing ... it could be a combination of many. Yet, in reviewing each, none of them really seem to strike me as 'correct' ... But I suppose the point is moot. I spent the evening with a close friend, I've been constructive, I'm now in possession of sixteen episodes of yum and I even have a half-decent drawing to show for the day. All in all, I am feeling much better now than I was earlier, even if I do still feel sensitive, and more than a fair bit uncertain, at least I'm not a wriggling ball of emotion anymore. And oh, how I do love this song. "All of my memories keep you near; your silent whispers, and silent tears."

Heh, just kidding. But really, yo; that one box in the back is bigger than I am. I was actually *inside* of the thing earlier when I was mucking about with dimensions. Cardboard, score! XD Only ... I accidentally scratched the unholy hell out of my poor roomie's truck in snaking it. =( ... Okay, so it's not THAT bad but I still feel really rotten about it. He said I'd be able to buff it out, but from now on, I kype cardboard in my own vehicle. > >; ... oh, my gods. The Bunny is EATING ME ALIVE. It doesn't shut up. *dies, and goes back to sketching preliminary schematics* Oh, yah, looks like the laptop was not enough for them. They had to have the box, too. XD
"Megatron!! Get out of my head, Megatron!! GYAAAAAAHHH!!!" XD "... I'm the Jugger-tron, bitch!" Happy Birthday Atoshi!! <3

Everyone needs to go see Transformers. Yes. NOW. Actually. I have to admit, I was a huge skeptic, myself. I almost didn't want to go at all; I'd seen the previews and all the oversized cardboard stand-ups in the movie theaters, and I didn't think that it would be all that great. Guess what? It's that great. =3 And I am a very, very happy 80s fangirl right now. Optimus makes me a pleased Pika. And Bumblebee is too damn cute for words. ^ ^ Quotes that I'm allowed to throw around without fear of spoiling the movie for anyone else: "Autobots! Roll out!" "I am Megatron!" (Bitch!) "Well, we don't have to call it that ... we can call it 'Sam's Happy Time' ..." (Also known as 'fixing the under-kimono' ... XD) But believe me, there were many, many more wonderful quotes from that movie (most of 'em concerning lubricant [< ) that I can't say because they'd either make no sense to anyone who hasn't seen the movie, or would ruin a perfectly good chortle in the theater, so ... GO SEE IT! =3 Oh, yeah, last thing: they used the 'transformation sequence' sound straight out of the cartoon. *happy shivers* Yey. <3 And Optimus Prime is voiced by the same voice actor who voiced him in the original series!! And Megatron is voiced by Hugo Weaving!! Oh, the love! P.S. - ... did you know that Peter Cullen, the actor who voices Optimus, is also Murky Dismal/Monstromurk from Rainbow Brite, Eeyore from Winnie the Pooh, and Captain Crabnasty from My Little Pony and Friends?! I didn't! *dies from gonkage* But to boost his cool factor, he was also in Voltron, GoBots, Dungeons and Dragons the series, and just about any and everything else I can remember from the era. ^ ^; I didn't realize how much he'd been in! It was pretty fun to read his filmography. It was like the Energizer Bunny; it just kept going, and going, and going ... P.P.S. - ... speak of Bunnies ... > >; GAH.

"No ... I cannot tell you ... but I can show you here on my Super Shiny Silver Abs of Seeing!!!" ... only one person on my FriendsList will get that, but oh well; it's still funny, darn it! The explanation of the title in a nutshell = went to see F4: Rise of the Silver Surfer last night, and many silver penis jokes ensued. Did not help at all that two of us were just coming down off of the weekend-long AX high, and had just blown the last of our remaining energy playing DDR at the nearby arcade. It was most definitely the way to end the weekend. =3 ... P.S. - Dude, he shows videos on his stomach; doesn't that make Silver Surfer a Teletubbie?! I still wanna know how many channels he picks up on that six-pack. XD Con Report to follow 'cause I'm still too tired to multi-task very well.

<lj-cut text="Still more nonesense for the mid-day hour.">Ha ha, my pony came in the mail today ... XD  Good gawds, I'm such a retard sometimes.  But I am oh-so-easily amused by all of it, and I guess that in the end, that tiny little druggie rush of happiness is all that matters, ne?

My boss just walked past in blue jeans.  Yesterday he talked to me and my co-worker outside for thirty minutes while smoking a cigar.  Last week he was storming up and down the hallway cursing about Intel and Qualcomm to one of the other sales managers.  And I thought that Quiksilver was unconventional!

^ ^</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="... and entirely pointless.">... dude.  I just totally constructed my holster belt pattern out of a paper KFC bag.  > >;  And it only took me three tries!

Now, the single question remaining is ... 

... WHAT THE #@%$! AM I DOING AWAKE?!

P.S. - Why yes, yes I am still alive.

^ ^</lj-cut>

Dear diary ...

... why the #@%$ did I take this job?!

Gah.  Don't mind me; I'm just stressing.  I was on such a euphoric cloud after this weekend and last, too ... darn it!

I refuse to be daunted by this crap; I won't let work rob me of my happiness.
I refuse to be daunted by this crap; I won't let work rob me of my happiness.
I refuse to be daunted by this crap; I won't let work rob me of my happiness ...

<lj-cut text="Insert Nonsense Here:">... I just found out that there's a Mondo here.  And his last name is Marron.  Mondo Marron.  Pardon me whilst the crossover fangirl in me comes up with amusing mental pictures.


P.S. - I can't frakking get the Stalker Song out of my head.  For some reason, every other song that I've heard play lately (with, ironically enough, the exception of Depeche Mode which I can apparently recognize without difficulty, even from across the office) has sounded just like the opening rhythms of that song.  Argh.  I'm going to have to go home and dig it out of the CD shelves, and play it, just so that I can get it out of my mind.

XP</lj-cut>

My Grandfather passed away last night.

I wanted to be with him, I wanted to at least be there.  I've always known that someday ... someday this would happen, and as I have grown older, I have known that this someday was moving steadily, inexorably closer.  But I thought that I would have warning ... that I would be able to be with my family when the Time came.

But no-one knew that the Time had come.

I won't be here for a while ... I'm sorry.

<lj-cut text="-Status Report-">------
-STATUS REPORT-
------
GOT:
- Insomnia.  XD

PROGRESS:
- Finally resolved the upper garment pattern!  Hurrah!!
- Pinned, pressed, and sewed upper garment strips.
- Turned the WHOLE DAMN THING inside-out (have you ever tried to reverse twelve yards of fabric, five inches wide before?  It's NOT easy).
- Painted pattern.
- Hemmed undershirt(s).

NOTES:
- All right, it FIGURES that I would come to the brink of giving up before I actually catch a break.  XP  You see, I couldn't for the life of me figure out how to wrap the over-garment and so I was just about to abandon the whole idea, because the only alternative I could think of was to cut it into pieces and sew the individual pieces together in accordance to the image, which I knew I would not have the time for doing.  But I finally had an epiphany last night; if there's one thing I've learned in my years of cosplay, it's that guys have a better spatial orientation that women do.  I'm sorry gals, it's the statistical truth.  So, hat in hand (or headband, at least), I went and pathetically begged my roomie for insights.

And the punk proceeded to take about ten minutes to resolve the winding sequence that had been boggling my mind since Sunday.  > <;  Apparently it's just a basic Roman wrap (which I wouldn't know since I didn't frequent any toga parties while I was in the dorms, =P) with a couple of extra loops on the bottom.  How he knew that I'm not entirely sure, but I half-suspect that it may be due to his days in Latin Club ... but whatever the case, in this moment I am entirely grateful that my room-mate is apparently even geekier than I.  =D

Problem solved.  Confidence restored.  I don't care if I don't sleep tonight, I'm gonna finish this!

^ ^

- Despite my better judgment, I decided not to paint on a portion of the pattern.  The necessary base is there, but I didn't put in the smaller details.  *cries*  I feel so sacrilegious; I abhor skimping.  But if I stand any chance of this thing drying in time to be wearable at eleven, I have to cut this corner.  Bloody hell.  *sad*  At least it still looks good.

STATE:
99% complete.   If the fabric paint has dried by tomorrow morning, then I will have succeeded!  And so ... it rests in the hands of the CosPlay Gods, now.

Pray for me?

^ ^;</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="-Status Report-">------
-STATUS REPORT-
------
GOT:
- A pretty blue crystal! ^ ^

PROGRESS:
- Cut and prepped upper garment material.
- Sewed undershirts.

NOTES:
- Took the upper garment material with me to work today, and commandeered the island in the little-used tech room in order to measure and cut and trim (and trim and trim and trim) it all up on my lunch break.  Despite copious amounts of ironing and more work than I ought to have spent on the stuff, however, I'm still somewhat at a loss.  Those bloody strips are going to be the death of me, I swear it.  XP  And while I may have initially berated myself for having done so, right about now I am very glad that I took the liberty of purchasing three yard's worth of it, because I'm almost positive that I'll be in need of more before I'm done.

- In a moment of either idiocy or inspiration (I'm not quite certain which, as yet) I came up with the idea to combine the two undershirts into one garment.  However, what seemed at first a brilliant move ended up becoming more trouble than I really had the time for, considering my lack of days left in which to work.  I rather half-heartedly blame the materials that I'm working with ... and Zach, you were SO very right.

STATE:
70% complete, and exhausted as hell.  *grimaces slightly*  Kids, I hate to be a downer, especially since I've come so far, but this is beginning to look doubtful for Saturday morning.  I haven't given up all hope, as yet, but unless the upper garment decides to behave itself, then I'm rather sunk.  Plus I have to allocate some time for constructing that crystal necklace (which will be the second of two that I'll have made in a week, I realize with some measure of idle amusement), and while I have all the necessary materials, I don't know how long it will take me.  I'm hoping that I can make a lunchtime project out of it tomorrow ... oh, wait, that's right; I'm not going to get a lunch tomorrow because my relief will be gone.  *sighs*  Oh, well.

I'm not going to throw in the towel just yet, though.  Where there is a will, there is a way, and I have been feeling ridiculously willful lately.  And weary, at the particular moment ... bed now for me.  Rest, yes ... </lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="-Status Report-">------
-STATUS REPORT-
------
GOT:
- A nice freaking burn on my middle finger, and a cut on my thumb.  =/  Owie.  *cries*

PROGRESS:
- SANDALS BABY!!  Complete and cooling.  OMGFTW.
- Washed upper garment fabric.
- Cut and pinned undershirt material.
- Procured eye pigment(s).

NOTES:
- Yeah, so, I found out earlier today that I had to wash the upper garment fabric before I painted it if I wanted it to turn out right.  Gee, wish that I would have had the presence of mind to do that last night instead of this morning.  It's taking forever for the material to dry, and I really wanted to start at least the basic underline tonight, so as to give it ample time to dry before adding the smaller details.  *sighs softly and then smiles*  Ah, well.  Better today than tomorrow!

- OMG sandals YAY.  Seriously.  I was scared to death of these things, but I actually did it!  I'm so very proud of me; today I have built myself my very first pair of cosplay shoes.  ^ ^  This is a skill that I will actually be needing in about a month when I get around to making the leather boots I'll require for my next cosplay ... Oh, but it should be noted that these things are far from perfect.  I screwed up rather heavily on the left sandal because I was modifying the pattern on the fly without an initial draft, and as such, that shoe is entirely ghetto-fabulous.  It totally bags around my ankle.  XP  But they're done and even actually almost comfy.  O O

- I dug out the most uber-perfect eyeshadow for this cosplay out of my secret stash of makeup earlier, colour-matched through PhotoShop and all ('cause I couldn't quite tell if it was one colour or another so I put it to the Colour Picker).  PhotoShop never lies!  ^ ^

- Heh.  I don't want to hear a word about the material I ended up using for my sleeve.  u u;  It was the correct colour, and it was on hand.  I claim artistic interpretation!  (Ya, right.  XD  Middy-san knows what I'm on about.)

STATE:
Uhm ... 25% complete ... maybe?  I would have given myself 30% if I had actually stitched the undershirt together like I had intended, but I'm tiring out, and I know from experience that sleepy plus sewing machine equals heartache. > >;

More to come!</lj-cut>

... for all those who have gone before.

<lj-cut text="Reminiscence.">No, it's not what you're thinking, and it's not as bad as it sounds.  Tonight is actually going to be my last somber 'Journal entry for a while.  I promise!

Tonight, as silly as it sounds, I mourn the passing of the Irvine Manga House.  I've been through a number of anime shops, by now ... and I watched sadly as the Santa Monica and Torrance Mandarakes and the Ontario and Orange Manga Houses shut their doors for good.  Manga House was my last remaining anime bastion in south Orange County ... and now it, too, has gone away.

There are still anime shops to be found (in Los Angeles county), and there is always the internet for all of one's otaku needs, but the Manga House at the Irvine Spectrum was singularly special to me.  Manga House was my first addiction, the gateway drug, if you will, that led me down the path to anime; I was introduced to it in my first year of college, back when it was still a hole-in-the-wall on the Spectrum, and I've followed it through three moves, countless managers, and the epic loss of its DDR machine.  My Sephiroth resin, my Zim plushie, my Evangelion scrolls ... all my favourites came from Manga House.  Omega's first cosplay'd DDR tournament was there, along with numerous Rocket mini-reunions ... hell, I even met my last boyfriend there, once upon a time.  It was common ground, and renown throughout the OC.  It held so many memories ...

Spectrum used to be my most frequented hangout ... but lately all that's brought me back there has been Manga House.  And now it's gone, forcing me to drive all the way up to Long Beach, kidnapping friends for moral support while I try to fill the gaping hole that it has left in my heart.

=P</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Just not right.">Some of you know that I've been taking up motorcycles, and have been taking skill classes on the weekends.  Last Friday my instructor's bike was stolen.  I feel so badly for him ... of course the police were called, and even though he knows exactly who took the motorcycle (because he saw the thief riding on it later in the day), he could not prove or point him out to the authorities because no one knew which apartment the crook lives in.  I can only imagine his frustration, but it is clear to hear in his voice.

And I wish that there was something that I could do, but there is nothing.  That motorcycle is my instructor's livelihood; he uses it to teach, which is his primary means of income.  Not only that, but it's a race machine, and it's his means of competition and recreation alike.  He was at the top of his class in the circuit, and now that the bike is gone, he can no longer compete.  He is such a kind individual, and one of the most careful tutors I've ever worked with; his classes adore him, and his students excel.  It is absolutely not fair that this should have happened to him.</lj-cut>

*sighs*

<lj-cut text="...and the random.">... in other news, I just got a voice-mail from Samuel L. Jackson.  O o;  Looks like my room-mate found a Snakes on a Plane soundboard.

I got both my bone spacers and my wolf fangs today ... this cheers me some.

One of the vendors brought me lunch.  It was quite the surprise and a little bit awkward ... but that cheered me also.</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="The latest CosPlay:">And I got the elusive black band that would make or break my attempt at putting together a cosplay in a week ... this cheers me substantially.  XD  I spent the weekend contributing bits and pieces to my friends' latest cosplay endeavour, and I suppose that their rabid enthusiasm rubbed off on me.  ^ ^  And it also doesn't help that the one of them is the King of All CosPlay Bunnies ...

So now, we will see if I have the skills to have an entire costume drafted, resolved, and completed in just five (work)days.

Wish me luck!

------
-STATUS REPORT-
------
GOT:
- Black headband
- Kunai (2)
- Black sandals (base only)
- Finger tape
- Hand tape

PROGRESS:
- Measurements.  XD  No heavy construction as yet.</lj-cut>

1% complete ... if even that. *laughs*

"It has been a weekend for blood," he said, and silently I agreed. Blood upon my split lip, a wound I gave myself, a metallic tang that touches my tongue when I bite my lip to hold my words, or when I smile for others. Blood upon my companion's foot, a wound that I gave him unwillingly, staining the carpet with his red and my guilt when he walks. Blood within a plastic tube, draping languidly from my Grandfather's bedside, trickling crimson as he fights to draw his breath. Blood upon my Mother's hands as she weeps, slowly staining the towel that she cradles helplessly in her lap. Blood upon grey fur, slowing as the swaddled bundle becomes still. Blood upon my comrade's face, garish against the white of the hospital that surrounds her as she sleeps. Blood from within me as an old wound bleeds again. "So much blood." It is only natural that we bleed. In fact, it is a necessary part of the healing process to do so; blood cleanses the wound, clots upon the flesh, and forms a scab to shield the fragile skin as it mends. My Grandfather used to tell me to let the blood come, when I was a child, and I fell and hurt myself some way ... "Let it bleed." But it hurts. It hurts so much to bleed. And it hurts so much more to watch others bleed. And the hurt becomes an excruciating pain when one realizes her own helplessness, when one comes into the knowledge that there is simply nothing more that can be done. The blood continues to flow, the crimson grows in clarity until the red is all there is, glistening and heartrending and real. So real that it remains when the eyes are closed, and when one turns away. So real that it remains, even when one sleeps, and when one dreams ... so real that it persists, flowing ceaselessly ... overpoweringly ... until every conscious though becomes a miserable memory and every passing dream fills up with nightmarish despair. "We affect those things that we can change, and accept those that we cannot." I wish that I could clear my mind, and my sight, of all of this blood. I don't want to forget, but I wish that I could push it away, just for a while, in order to allow myself enough time to recover. I continue on ... I have to. But for all of the blood I have seen this week, for all of the pain I have been feeling, I wonder that I do not cry. I have bled in more ways than just the one, in these past few days ... I feel as if I have drained myself of energy and intensity as well. My emotion has already bled away ... and I am so empty now, and so weary, that it is difficult to focus on anything at all. I feel so cold ... Gods, why can't I cry? I felt it; I almost felt it this weekend, as I stood with my arms around my little Brother, holding him as his shoulders shook with sobs. I felt it rising inside of me as I comforted my Mother as she knelt crumpled on the grass; I wanted to weep as she did. I felt as if a part of me was being torn away ... I could feel the pain in my heart, but I could give it no voice. Instead I simply acted ... in throwing myself into the moment I was able to overcome the ache inside of me, I was able to quiet it for a time. It does not go away, and it is there, as soon as I come to rest again, waiting to haunt me ... but I persist, as it persists, and although I hurt inside, I am not overthrown. I cannot change everything; I am not a god. I can, however, be there for those who need me, and I can strive to help those who can be helped, and alter or improve the situations that I can influence ... my only difficulty lies in accepting the fact that I cannot influence everything. Although I know that I am not, some days I want to be a god. I want to help. I want to prevent others from suffering. I want to be able to make the pain go away, whether or not it is humanly possible ... I want to make it better. And when I come to that cursed point of realization I feel myself to be at my weakest, my most helpless state ... I feel as if I have become worthless to the world. But I am learning to accept ... I am learning to stop, to breathe, and to refocus myself on what can be changed, instead of clinging uselessly to that which cannot. For it is only when I refuse to let go that I have in truth become worthless ... it is only when I allow my energy to be wasted in mourning that which is beyond my power to control that I have truly become a waste. Therefore I will be strong, both for myself, and for those that have need of my strength. I will endure ...
